title: How to Draw a Tennis Racket

steps.headline: Draw an oval shape, like an egg standing vertically.
steps.description: This will be the outside of the stringed area.

steps.headline: Draw lines going horizontally inside the oval all the way down, like latitude lines.
Finish the stringed area of the racket by drawing vertical lines all the way across the oval, like longitude lines.
Draw a bigger oval outside of the first oval.
Draw a an isosceles triangle pointing down, so that its base is the bottom of the large oval.
Underneath the triangle, draw a long vertical rectangle.
steps.description: The tip of the triangle should be touching the middle of the line serving as the top of the rectangle. This rectangle will be the handle of the racket.

steps.headline: Draw a diagonal line from the top right corner of the rectangle to a little bit right to the end of the line making the triangle's base, on the right side.
Erase lines as needed, including the top base of the rectangle, the lines of the large oval in between the right and left ends of the triangle's base, and the diagonal lines you drew.

text: Draw an oval shape, like an egg standing vertically. This will be the outside of the stringed area. Draw lines going horizontally inside the oval all the way down, like latitude lines.  Finish the stringed area of the racket by drawing vertical lines all the way across the oval, like longitude lines.  Draw a bigger oval outside of the first oval.  Draw a an isosceles triangle pointing down, so that its base is the bottom of the large oval.  Underneath the triangle, draw a long vertical rectangle. The tip of the triangle should be touching the middle of the line serving as the top of the rectangle. This rectangle will be the handle of the racket. Draw a diagonal line from the top right corner of the rectangle to a little bit right to the end of the line making the triangle's base, on the right side.  Repeat with the left side.  Erase lines as needed, including the top base of the rectangle, the lines of the large oval in between the right and left ends of the triangle's base, and the diagonal lines you drew.  Color as desired.
